class_notes:
This course explores creative approaches to recorded sound. Students will learn to use microphones and the Reaper audio editing software to edit and create audio compositions. Students will explore various creative audio practices, including sampling, field recording, binaural audio, musique concr√®te, voice-over, foley, sound design and other techniques in concert and studio environments. The final project will be a class collaboration to create a sound installation using the samples and sequences that the students have accumulated during the semester. This course is designed for composition students but is open to other interested students who have completed the prerequisite MUS 347 or who receive permission of the instructor.
